thread.title: Alphabet's profit jumps 73 percent in first quarter

title: Alphabet's profit jumps 73 percent in first quarter
text:
April 23, 2018 / 8:13 PM / Updated 11 minutes ago Alphabet's profit jumps 73 percent in first quarter Reuters Staff 1 Min Read 
(Reuters) - Alphabet Inc’s ( GOOGL.O ) profit jumped about 73 percent in the first three months of the year, as Google’s parent company benefited from soaring sales of internet advertisements. FILE PHOTO: The Google logo is pictured atop an office building in Irvine, California, U.S., August 7, 2017. REUTERS/Mike Blake/File Photo 
Alphabet said here on Monday first-quarter net income rose to $9.4 billion or $13.33 per Class A and B common share and Class C capital share, from $5.43 billion or $7.73 per share a year earlier. 
Revenue jumped to $31.15 billion from $24.75 billion. Reporting by Arjun Panchadar in Bengaluru; Editing by Sai Sachin Ravikumar
